Class ExecutionGridRepresenter

Namespace
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.Representers.Grids
Assembly
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.dll

Representer for any grid with records of Execution type It defines the basic version of the item ExecutionGridRepresenter.Item that stores order properties. Each property of ExecutionGridRepresenter.Item that has FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Attributes.DisplayPropertyAttribute is mapped to grid column (FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Representers.Grids.GridRepresenter<T>.ColumnDescriptors)

public class ExecutionGridRepresenter : GridRepresenter<ExecutionGridRepresenter.Item>

Remarks

How to add new attributes to ExecutionGridRepresenter.Item and map them to grid columns:

  1. Add new public property. If it relates to price, quantity, money, percentage or enum, use appropriate representers (for example, MoneyRepresenter, QuantityRepresenter, InstrumentRepresenter, etc)
  2. Add FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Attributes.DisplayPropertyAttribute to the property to make it visible in the grid as a column
  3. Add FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Attributes.ColumnWidthAttribute or FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Attributes.ColumnWidthInferenceAttribute to set up the initial column width About column widths: each visual column must have either to be an explicitly defined with (FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Attributes.ColumnWidthAttribute set for the property) width or an implicitly defined via representer type (MoneyRepresenter for example)

Note: in some tasks, ExecutionGridRepresenter.Item may be used outside of grid context or for grids with explicitly defined columns. In other words, FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Representers.Grids.GridRepresenter<T>.ColumnDescriptors is not really used. In this case, declared attributes do not make any sense and may be ignored
